definition: to see in the New Year/to welcome new guests/by extension, to receive new students
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
usher out the old, greet the new/esp. to see in the New Year

sentences.english: Ring out the old, ring in the new.
Good mid-winter to spring has, year-end score step by step.
sentences.chinese: 冬去春來好景年年有，辭舊迎新成績步步高。

sentences.english: Welcome party, English songs, language games, film shows, outings.
sentences.chinese: 迎新，聽歌學英文，語文遊戲，電影欣賞，參觀。

sentences.english: My feet still ached from the morning orientation and the tour of the school.
sentences.chinese: 經過早上的迎新會和校園參觀，腳也開始隱隱作痛。

sentences.english: We are once again gathered here on this joyful occasion to celebrate the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我們再次在這裏歡聚一堂，共迎新年。

sentences.english: Almost everyone makes an occasion of New Year's Eve in order to see the old year out and welcome the new one.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎人人都把除夕作爲送舊迎新的時刻來慶祝。

sentences.english: I especially excited, and called his father go with me to light firecrackers, renewing it.
sentences.chinese: 我特別激動，趕緊叫着爸爸同我去放炮竹，辭舊迎新。

sentences.english: Year of the Rabbit gets Sydney hopping.
sentences.chinese: 海外華人迎新春，悉尼同胞慶兔年。

sentences.english: The annual College Students Welcome Party will be held on Saturday 8-29-2009. Rev.
sentences.chinese: 一年一度的迎新聚會將於八月二十九日星期六舉行。

sentences.english: Willing to superior quality and first-class services Meet the new and old customers.
sentences.chinese: 願以優異的品質和一流的服務笑迎新老客戶。

sentences.english: In the past, we used to gather under the Town Hall clock to welcome the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 我們過去常聚集在市政廳的大鐘下面迎新年。

sentences.english: The presentation was held in the Kennedy Auditorium.
sentences.chinese: 這次迎新會在肯尼迪禮堂舉行。

sentences.english: Freshers' week at most universities starts on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 大多數高校的迎新周始於週一。

sentences.english: Tomorrow is New Year's Eve, the year the last day of New Year.
sentences.chinese: 明天就是除夕夜了，一年的最後一天，辭舊迎新。

sentences.english: This is orientation week for all the new students.
sentences.chinese: 這是所有新生都參加的迎新情況介紹周。

sentences.english: Out with the old, in with the new seemed to be the theme of Tuesday night's " Hellcats."
sentences.chinese: 去舊迎新可以說是本集《地獄貓》的主題了。

definition: the beginning of Spring/the 10 or 20 days following the lunar New Year's Day
to step into the new year/New Year
to arrive as planned/right on schedule
to accept the new/to take fresh (air)/fig. to accept new members (to reinvigorate the party)/new blood
anniversary of the founding of a school
